intro: Thysselinum plinii, commonly known as the Plinius's thistle, is a species of flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plant is characterized by its spiny leaves and yellow-orange composite flowers that bloom in the summer months. Thysselinum plinii thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sunlight to flourish. It is often found in rocky or alpine environments, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
